antiPatterns.name: Combinatorial Explosion
antiPatterns.description: A subtle form of duplication, this smell exists when numerous pieces of code do the same thing using different combinations of data or behavior
antiPatterns.cause: Lack of refactoring and awareness of changing concerns, making naive design decisions.
antiPatterns.solution: Perhaps use generics or an interpreter. Or factor out strategies.
antiPatterns.example: Encryption with different algorithms. Adding new algorithm can lead to a class explosion.
sources: @book{Kerievsky, author = {Kerievsky, Joshua}, title = {Refactoring to Patterns}, year = {2004}, isbn = {0321213351}, publisher = {Pearson Higher Education}}
